oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Wesley Rose interviewed by Bob Allen in 1979
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Wesley Rose being interviewed by Bob Allen. The recording takes place on 8-27-79.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wesley Rose
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:00) -- Bob Allen asks Wesley Rose about a few of the projects he's currently involved in. (0:20) -- Wesley Rose describes "Acuff/Rose Musicals Inc." - a venture to put on a musical about Hank Williams. (1:08) -- Wesley Rose mentions that the purpose of the show is to give the performance Hank Williams would've given the night he passed away (New Year's Day). (2:58) -- Bob Allen asks Wesley Rose about working with Jim Owens. (5:29) -- Wesley Rose describes his personal criticism of portrayals/impressions of Hank Williams. (5:56) -- Bob Allen asks Wesley Rose about Hank Williams' financial situation when he passed away. (9:32) -- Wesley Rose discusses Hank Williams' passing and managing his records through MGM Records. (10:40) -- Wesley Rose mentions that Frank Walker introduced him to Bob Whiteman, the head of MGM Studios. Bob Whiteman spoke to Wesley Rose that he could change anything in the script he desired if he felt it was incorrect to Hank Williams' story. (13:28) -- Wesley Rose speaks about George Hamilton's interest in Hank Williams. (15:09) -- Wesley Rose clarifies that Hank Williams Jr. was put on MGM Records by his mother, Audrey. (16:53) -- Bob Allen asks about lawsuits Wesley Rose has been involved in considering the Hank Williams' catalog. (19:20) -- Wesley Rose speaks of the ruling of Billie Jean Horton. (21:48) -- Bob Allen asks about a painting in Wesley Rose's office. (22:07) -- Wesley Rose mentions that he has Roy Acuff's first fiddle. (22:25) -- Bob Allen asks about Fred Rose's drinking habits in relation to Hank Williams. Wesley answers that his father was a very religious man and didn't drink much. (23:23) -- Bob Allen asks Wesley Rose about his business relations to MCA. (25:40) -- Bob Allen asks Wesley Rose about his distaste for pop music crossing over into country music. (27:40) -- Bob Allen asks Wesley Rose about his offer to buy the Grand Ole Opry with Connie B. Gay for five million dollars. (29:34) -- Bob Allen asks Wesley Rose about his recreational sports hobbies. (33:15) -- Bob Allen asks about Acuff/Rose's international representation of the Pamper company. (35:26) -- Wesley Rose speaks about being chairman of the board at the CMA. (36:36) -- Wesley Rose speaks about the accuracy of Billboard's charts related to radio stations. (42:12) -- Wesley Rose speaks about independent radio station's ability to buy time.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Rose, Wesley;
